p: Larifan (produced by Larifan Ltd., Latvia) is a drug containing the replicative form of bacteriophage f2 dsRNA, obtained from Escherichia coli cells infected with the phage. Based on phage dsRNA, several dosage forms have been developed: the injection form of Larifan, an antiviral and immunostimulatory drug with antitumor activity; Larifan ointment and suppositories [ 54].
